meanings.definition: A title of honor given to certain members of the clergy in the Roman Catholic Church.
meanings.sent1: The monsignors in the church wore special robes.
meanings.sent2: The monsignors gathered for a meeting at the Vatican.
meanings.sent3: The monsignors decided to have a pizza party after the service.
meanings.sent4: The monsignors stood out like shining stars in their elegant attire.
meanings.sent5: The monsignors' presence added a sense of reverence to the ceremony.

meanings.sent1: We invited the monsignors to lead the procession.
meanings.sent2: The monsignors' responsibilities include assisting the bishop.
meanings.sent3: The monsignors' hats blew away in the strong wind.
meanings.sent4: The monsignors' voices echoed through the grand cathedral.
meanings.sent5: The monsignors' dedication to their duties was truly admirable.
